content.text:
## What’s Included in the Stretch Zone Monthly Cost?

The Stretch Zone membership model is straightforward. It’s based on a monthly subscription that gives you access to a set number of assisted stretching sessions each month. There are a few membership tiers to choose from:

  * 4 stretch sessions per month: This basic membership option worth around $99 provides 4 stretch sessions a month. Perfect for those wanting to supplement an existing workout routine with improved flexibility training.
  * 8 stretch sessions per month: The most popular level costs about $199 and provides 8 stretch sessions per month or 2 visits per week. This allows enough frequency to experience meaningful improvements in flexibility, mobility, and muscle recovery.
  * 12 stretch sessions per month: For maximum flexibility and recovery benefits, the top-tier membership costs $299 and includes 12 stretch sessions per month, or 3 visits per week. Ideal for athletes, fitness enthusiasts, and those overcoming injuries.

Each stretch session at a Stretch Zone studio lasts 25 minutes and is fully assisted 1-on-1 by a certified FlexologistTM. They use the patented Stretch Zone Stretching System to bring your major muscle groups through gentle, relaxing stretches with the aid of stabilization straps and supported positions, depending on your specific needs.

This allows your body to move deeper into a stretch without compromising form or risking injury. Stretch Zone is suitable for all fitness levels and provides personalized programs to meet your needs.

Of course, Stretch Zone isn’t the only company to offer massage bed straps and stabilization straps, as this is nothing new or groundbreaking.

There are quite a few chiropractors, massage therapists, as well as physiotherapists that isolate the pelvic region, the hips, or the back of their patients with the help of straps in their treatment rooms. One example of a chain that also uses straps is 【39†Stretch Lab】.

## Stretch Zone Prices vs Other Fitness Programs

When comparing the monthly cost of Stretch Zone to other fitness options like yoga, Pilates, personal training, and gym memberships, Stretch Zone is very competitively priced. Here’s a breakdown:

  * Yoga classes: Average $10-$20 per drop-in class, so about $80-$160 per month if visiting weekly. No personalized guidance.
  * Pilates classes: Similarly priced to yoga, around $10-$25 per class or $80-$200 monthly with weekly classes. Equipment training will be additional cost.
  * Personal training: Ranges from $50-$150+ per hour-long session. Monthly cost for 2x weekly training would be $400-$1,200+.
  * Gym membership: Typically $30-$50 per month for gym access. No dedicated programming or guidance included.
  * Stretch Zone prices: Just $99-$299 per month for 4-12 assisted stretching sessions. Every session at Stretch Zone Includes 1-on-1 guidance from a certified trainer.

When factoring in the personalized attention, targeted stretching techniques, and expertise behind each Stretch Zone session, the membership offers excellent value, especially compared to hiring private personal trainers.

Stretch Zone’s consistent focus on flexibility and mobility training also provides more specialized benefits compared to a general gym membership or group fitness classes.

## Additional Services With Stretch Zone Membership

The Stretch Zone membership fee covers far more than just stretch sessions. Members also enjoy:

  * Initial evaluation: A trained Flexologist evaluates your body mechanics, muscle tension, and range of motion to design a customized program.
  * Ongoing assessments: Flexologists continually re-assess your flexibility gains and adjust your program as needed.
  * Unlimited stretching advice: Ask your Flexologist flexibility or stretching questions anytime to get expert guidance.
  * Member-only events: Enjoy community events like mobility workshops and friend/family stretch events.
  * Nationwide access: Visit any Stretch Zone location when traveling.

For members needing extra attention on problem areas or athletic performance prep, Stretch Zone also offers add-on services like:

  * Targeted 30-minute stretch sessions
  * Pre-workout activation stretches
  * Physical therapy support

These specialty services allow further customization of your program for maximal results.

## Benefits a Stretch Zone Membership Provides

While the Stretch Zone membership fee provides obvious value, the benefits you experience from improved flexibility and mobility are priceless. Here are some of the many ways members feel better:

  * Increased range of motion: Stretch regularly tight joints and muscles.
  * Reduced muscle tension: Loosen up tightness and relieve aches and pains.
  * Enhanced athletic performance: Better mobility for strength and agility.
  * Improved posture: Stand and move with better alignment.
  * Decreased risk of injury: Flexible muscles help prevent strains and pulls.
  * Faster recovery: Flush out lactic acid and reduce soreness.
  * Less stress: Stretching induces relaxation and decreases stress hormones.
  * Better sleep: Calm muscles help you fall asleep and stay asleep.
  * Increased balance and coordination: Flexibility contributes to overall body control.

With a diverse membership base that includes seniors, athletes, corporate employees, fitness enthusiasts, and more, the vast benefits of improved flexibility are far-reaching. Consistent stretching at Stretch Zone enhances physical and mental wellbeing for all.

## Budgeting for Your Health Through Stretch Zone Membership

Investing in your health is one of the wisest financial decisions you can make. When weighing the cost of a Stretch Zone membership, consider how regular stretching will reduce future healthcare costs associated with avoidable injuries, pain, and tension.

View the membership fee as a preventative health expense that pays dividends through improved quality of life.

Here are some tips for budgeting for your Stretch Zone membership:

  * Take advantage of discounted enrollments and membership fees.
  * Break costs down weekly or monthly rather than a large annual fee.
  * Pair back other fitness expenses if needed to allocate funds to Stretch Zone.
  * Use pre

content.title: Stretch Zone Prices and Membership Cost 2024 ❤️ Official

content.text:
Moreover, the supportive atmosphere at Stretch Zone, where you can focus on your own workout in a welcoming environment, can significantly contribute to reaching your fitness goals and improving your athletic performance.

## Optimal Frequency for Stretch Zone Sessions 

For optimal results, it is recommended to attend Stretch Zone sessions regularly. The frequency of your sessions will depend on your individual goals and requirements. While it can vary from person to person, most individuals benefit from attending two or three sessions per week to achieve significant improvements in flexibility and mobility over time.

Consistency is key, as regular sessions help maintain and enhance the benefits gained from stretching exercises. It’s a good practice to consult with a Stretch Zone professional who can provide personalized recommendations based on your specific fitness goals and needs.

## Transparent Pricing 

Stretch Zone prides itself on providing transparent pricing and membership options to its clients. There are no hidden fees or additional costs associated with Stretch Zone memberships. The pricing structure is designed to be all-inclusive, covering the cost of sessions and any other services included in the package.

However, before joining, it’s essential to review the membership details and inquire about any specific terms and conditions that may apply. This ensures that your experience with Stretch Zone is straightforward, and there are no unexpected expenses.

## Sharing Your Membership 

Stretch Zone acknowledges the value of motivation and accountability when it comes to achieving fitness goals. As a member, you have the option to share the benefits of your Stretch Zone membership with a family member or friend. Stretch Zone provides options for adding a new participant to your membership, allowing both of you to enjoy Stretch Zone sessions together.

Sharing your membership not only inspires and motivates but also makes the stretching experience more enjoyable. It’s a fantastic opportunity to embark on your well-being journey with loved ones, supporting each other in achieving improved flexibility and mobility.

## Minimum Age Requirement 

Stretch Zone has a minimum age requirement for participants. The specific age requirements may vary depending on the studio’s location and policies. In general, Stretch Zone is designed for individuals aged 14 and above. It’s crucial to note that participants aged 18 and under may require parental consent and supervision.

Stretch Zone’s primary objective is to ensure the safety and well-being of its participants, and age-related rules are in place to support this goal. If you have questions or concerns about the age requirement, it’s advisable to contact the local Stretch Zone studio for specific details.

## Variability of Stretch Zone Prices by Location 

Stretch Zone prices can vary based on the studio’s location. Several factors influence the cost of memberships and sessions, including the local economy, operational expenses, and demand in the region. Urban areas with a higher cost of living may have slightly higher prices compared to rural or suburban locations.

For precise pricing information, as well as any special offers or discounts that may be available, it’s recommended to reach out to the Stretch Zone studio in your area. The staff at the studio can provide you with comprehensive pricing details specific to the nearest location.

## Convenient Payment Methods 

Stretch Zone accepts a variety of convenient payment methods for sessions and memberships. They understand that individuals have different preferences, so they accept major debit and credit cards, as well as online payment systems like PayPal. This flexibility in payment methods allows you to choose the option that best suits your needs while enjoying the benefits of Stretch Zone and becoming part of the Roar Fitness world.

## Flexible Membership Cancellation 

Life circumstances can change, and Stretch Zone recognizes the need for flexibility in its membership policies. If you need to pause or cancel your membership for any reason, you can do so at any time. Stretch Zone aims to provide a hassle-free experience for its members.

To initiate the cancellation process, it’s advisable to contact Stretch Zone’s staff directly and inquire about the specific cancellation procedure and any requirements. They are committed to ensuring that you have a pleasant and stress-free experience throughout the cancellation process.

## Monthly vs. Annual Memberships 

The main difference between a monthly and an annual membership at Stretch Zone lies in the duration and pricing structure. A monthly membership allows for monthly payments, providing flexibility and the ability to cancel or modify your membership when necessary. In contrast, an annual membership is a more extended commitment, typically lasting for one year.

The advantage of an annual membership is that it often comes at a reduced cost compared to a monthly subscription. The choice between the two options depends on your personal preferences, budget, and your commitment to attending Stretch Zone sessions regularly.

## Discounts for Students and Seniors 

Stretch Zone believes in making its services accessible to a wider range of individuals. As a result, they offer special discounts for students and seniors. Students with valid student IDs can enjoy reduced rates for private sessions and memberships. Likewise, seniors can benefit from discounted rates, recognizing the importance of maintaining flexibility and mobility at any stage of life.

These discounts provide students and seniors with the opportunity to enjoy the advantages of Stretch Zone at a more affordable cost. To learn more about the specific discounts offered to students and seniors in your area, it’s advisable to contact your nearest Stretch Zone studio.

## Additional Services Included 

Stretch Zone goes beyond stretching sessions by offering additional services included in your membership. While the details may vary by location, some of the most common extra services and benefits may include:

### 1. Free Consultations with a Stretch Zone Expert:

  * Members receive personalized advice and guidance from Stretch Zone experts to maximize the effectiveness of their stretching routines.

### 2. Workshops:

  * Stretch Zone organizes workshops and educational events, allowing members to discover the latest stretching methods, injury prevention, and overall health.

### 3. Exclusive Member Events:

  * Members are invited to exclusive events such as fitness challenges, guest speaker sessions, or celebrations, fostering a sense of community.

### 4. Partner Discounts:

  * Stretch Zone frequently partners with local businesses to offer exclusive discounts on items and services related to fitness, health, and overall well-being.

### 5.

content.title: What's the Cost of a Monthly Membership at Stretch Zone - Whats the Cost?

content.text:
### What Are the Advantages of Getting Stretched at Stretch Zone?

With Stretch Zone, you get personalized stretching sessions tailored to your individual needs. Their certified trainers use cutting-edge technology to ensure that you get the most effective stretching experience possible. Plus, you get access to additional services such as massage therapy, nutrition counseling, and lifestyle coaching.

### What Types of Results Can Be Expected?

Regular stretching at Stretch Zone can help improve flexibility, posture, mobility, and overall wellbeing. Many people report feeling less pain and tension in their bodies after just a few sessions. Additionally, regular stretching can help reduce stress and anxiety levels, improve sleep quality, and boost energy levels.

## How Much Does it Cost to Get Stretched at Stretch Zone?

The cost of getting stretched at Stretch Zone varies depending on the location and the type of session you choose. Generally, you can expect to pay between $45 and $95 for a single session. If you purchase a package of multiple sessions, you can get a discounted rate, with prices ranging from $50 to $80 per session.

### How Much Does It Cost for a Single Session of Stretching?

A single session of stretching at Stretch Zone typically costs between $45 and $95. The exact cost will vary depending on the location and the type of session you choose.

### What Kind of Packages Are Available?

Stretch Zone offers packages of multiple sessions at discounted rates. Prices range from $50 to $80 per session, depending on the number of sessions purchased. The packages are designed to help you save money while still getting the full benefit of the stretching service.

## Stretch Zone Cost: Are You Getting Value for Your Money?

When it comes to getting value for your money, Stretch Zone is definitely worth considering. Not only do you get personalized stretching sessions tailored to your individual needs, but you also get access to additional services such as massage therapy and nutrition counseling. Plus, the packages are designed to help you save money while still getting the full benefit of the stretching service.

### How Do the Prices Compare to Competitors?

Overall, Stretch Zone prices are competitive compared to other stretching services. Their packages offer great value for money and their membership plans provide even more savings. Plus, they offer discounts and promotions from time to time, so be sure to keep an eye out for those.

### Are There Any Hidden Costs or Fees That Should Be Taken Into Consideration?

No, there are no hidden costs or fees associated with Stretch Zone services. All prices are clearly listed on their website and all additional services are clearly marked. However, it’s important to note that some memberships require a minimum commitment period.

[Image 1: An Overview of Stretch Zone Prices and Packages]An Overview of Stretch Zone Prices and Packages

## An Overview of Stretch Zone Prices and Packages

Stretch Zone offers a variety of packages and prices to suit different budgets and needs. Here’s an overview of what you can expect to pay:

  * Single session stretching: $45 – $95
  * Packages (multiple sessions): $50 – $80 per session
  * Membership: $99 – $299 per month
  * Additional services (massage therapy, nutrition counseling, etc.): Varies depending on length of session and type of service ($50 – $75)

### What Are the Different Packages Available?

Stretch Zone offers packages of multiple sessions for a discounted rate. These packages range from 3 sessions to 12 sessions, with prices starting at $150. There are also special offers for new customers, such as a free session or a discounted package.

### What Is Included in Each Package?

Each package includes a certain number of stretching sessions, as well as discounts on additional services such as massage therapy and nutrition counseling. Plus, members get access to exclusive events and offers.

### Are There Any Special Offers or Discounts?

Yes, Stretch Zone does offer discounts and promotions from time to time. Be sure to check their website and social media pages for the latest deals.

## Conclusion

Stretch Zone is a professional stretching service that helps people improve their posture, mobility, flexibility, and overall wellbeing. The cost of their services varies depending on the type of session and package chosen, with prices ranging from $45 to $299 per month. When deciding whether or not Stretch Zone is worth the cost, it’s important to consider your individual needs and goals. With the right package, you can get great value for your money while still getting the full benefit of the stretching service.

content.text:
[Image 5: Home-Page-3]

## WHAT DRIVES US 

### Affordability 

MoreYoga has been dedicated to providing affordable and accessible yoga MoreYoga has been dedicated to providing affordable and accessible yoga since we opened in 2016. We looked around and saw just how many people were priced out of a regular in-studio practice, and knew that something had to change. Tired of yoga elitism, we brought yoga to the local communities of London - and are passionate about continuing our mission, knowing the positive impact it has on people’s lives.

### Passion for Community 

In a disconnected world, there is a power in coming together in a yoga studio to be part of an ancient practice. To connect our bodies and minds. To connect as part of something larger than ourselves and to connected, energised,  aligned  with other human beings has a powerful impact on our wellbeing. To then encourage our students to take that connection off the mat, living their yoga and giving back to local communities. Spreading compassion and love will always be at the heart of what we do.

### Prioritising Mental Health 

We have long recognised the power of yoga to help people with their mental health. In 2018 we started our MoreMind programme which was dedicated to developing a programme of courses, workshops and classes focused on positive Mental Health and a holistic approach to wellbeing. With so many studios focused purely on a physical practice, it was our goal to bring this to the fore - with so many of our team and clients having come to yoga for this reason. We strive to be thought leaders and always provide an offering, whether paid or unpaid, to help give people a way through.

### Progressive & Responsive 

We thrive on feedback from our community. As a small independent business we are agile and are continually looking to improve our service based on conversations with our customers, teachers and internal team. This progressive approach has helped build us into one of London's biggest yoga families!

### Anti-Diet Culture 

We firmly believe that every body is a yoga body. We strive to empower our community to live a balanced and healthy life. For too long yoga has been associated with a stereotyped body type and we want that stereotype thrown in the bin. Love and embrace the power of your physical self!

### Diversity in Wellness 

We pride ourselves on being one of the most diverse yoga studios in London. We are committed to driving conversations within the wellness industry and increasing representation. We offer BIPOC scholarships to our Yoga Teacher Training to try and increase representation within the industry and help change the status quo.

### As Featured In

[Image 6: Forbes]

[Image 7: Time Out]

[Image 8: Stylist]

[Image 9: Womens Health]

[Image 10: London Evening Standard]

[Image 11: Metro]

## WHAT OUR CUSTOMERS SAY 

Lovely place to do yoga and deepen your practice, quite a few classes that are varied to pick from everyday, prices are quite cheap for what you get. Studio itself is spacey, would recommend to both more advanced and beginners. Teachers make it possible for you to go at your pace and always give various ways to approach things.

Jamaal Scott MoreYoga Surrey Quays

[Image 12: Jamaal Scott]

I love MoreYoga, great prices, no unnecessary frills, good teachers, a great variety of classes and times. The Tower Bridge has a great location. Could not recommend more.

Alice Jameson MoreYoga Tower Bridge

[Image 13: Alice Jameson]

Great studio space with great teachers. I’ve been going for two months and not had a bad class yet! Nice mix of meditative and energetic classes.

William Brotherhood MoreYoga Tower Bridge

[Image 14: William Brotherhood]

I love this studio! Such a cool vibe in an unrivalled location, this studio is light and airy with really cool muralled walls and all designed in the trademark classic MoreYoga style. Teachers are as usual brilliant per the MoreYoga standards and the classroom size is just right. Love to see more studios like this one.

Anisa Patel MoreYoga Tower Bridge

[Image 15: Anisa Patel]

Lovely and airy space, wide variety of classes and high standard of teaching. A great place to practice yoga in central London for a reasonable price.

Hannah Kumari  MoreYoga Tower Bridge

[Image 16: Hannah Kumari ]

Teachers are really great! One of the best places in London to practice your yoga skills!! You can pratice a lots of differents types of yoga which is really great and shows you the infinite aspect of that discipline!

Ferre Guillaume 

[Image 17: Ferre Guillaume]

This is my favourite yoga studio in London. I like how dynamic the process is organised – you come, quickly sign in and start the class straight away. This is something which is extremely helpful in busy London life. Moreover I like that despite all the efficiency, the classes are very profound, the teachers are super experienced and the atmosphere is always welcoming and friendly. Really recommend!

Nellia Kornilova MoreYoga Caledonian Road

[Image 18: Nellia Kornilova]

Great studio with a variety of classes, very good value for money compared to other London studios and flexible booking that lets you change your mind up to 3 hours before the session without being charged. All classes are suitable for all levels of yoga and teachers really make an effort to give enough variations for each pose to make the practice interesting yet accessible to all yogis. So glad I found this studio and also love the fact that i ca visit their other studios as part of my membership.

Antonia Braun MoreYoga Wandsworth

[Image 19: Antonia Braun]

Another great s

Priory Park, Pavillion, N8 8LQ

Advertising

### 5. Down to Earth

[Image 8: Down to Earth]

[Image 9: Down to Earth]

【61†Down to Earth's†downtoearthlondon.co.uk】 peaceful flagship studio on Tufnell Park’s bustling Brecknock Road is a popular neighbourhood spot – on a Saturday morning there’s even a reserve queue! Founded by a design-loving Central St Martins graduate, the large upstairs studio has big windows all along the far wall and wooden floorboards, making it spacious and light. Classes run throughout the day all week, offering many types of yoga, as well as pilates, and there’s classes for kids and teens, too. There’s limited space to change – just two small cubicles – so most people arrive already in their kit. Mats are provided.  

Perfect for... Serene, sophisticated yogis 

Average price per class: yoga/pilates drop-in: £16

Introductory offer: £40 for 14 consecutive days of yoga and pilates at Tufnell Park

Monthly membership: £99 per month

Tufnell Park

【62†Book now†classpass.com】

### 6. Triyoga

[Image 10: Triyoga]

[Image 11: Triyoga]

Karen Yeomans

【63†Triyoga†triyoga.co.uk】 is a yogis paradise. Their studios, which are shoe-free-zones fyi, are all calming colours, raw materials and hushed tones. You’re met with the gentle scent of incense at the door, before you pad through to one of the studios. Triyoga have an impressive line-up of classes on their rosta, from classes designed for newbies or yin and restorative sessions for those wanting a gentler practise to dynamic vinyasa flow classes, ashtanga, nidra yoga and steamy hot yoga sessions. Kids, toddlers and teens can get stretchy at Triyoga too, and there are also classes for pregnancy, stress, back problems and free yoga for cancer classes to help cope with cancer and cancer treatments. With knowledgeable teachers, loads of open level classes and spacious facilities, Triyoga is a serene spot to escape the stress of the city and rediscover your zen. 

Perfect for... yogis wanting to explore and expand their practice

Price per class: From £12

Introductory offer: £35 for 7 consecutive days 

Monthly membership: £125 a month for unlimited classes. 

Find studios in Chelsea, Camden, Ealing  and Shoreditch

【64†Book now†triyoga.co.uk】

Advertising

### 7. Yoga on the Lane

[Image 12: Yoga on the Lane]

[Image 13: Yoga on the Lane]

Pauline Egge

This small, pretty yoga studio in Dalston is one of the most welcoming in East London – and that’s not only due to their toasty underfloor heating. Teaching classes of 15 students, Naomi Reynolds, a former ballet dancer, and her team of instructors are friendly and super-attentive, always finding time to work with each student. The practice is dynamic vinyasa yoga, but if you’re a total newbie this is still a good place to start. There are at least five A1 beginners’ classes a week, taught by one of the loveliest instructors around. Arrive early for the weekend morning classes, they fill up fast.

Perfect for… beginner-to-intermediate yogis looking for a bit of guidance

Average price per class: £15

Monthly membership: Ten Class Card (valid for three months) for £120

105 Shacklewell Lane, E8 2EB

【65†Book now†www.yogaonthelane.com】

### 8. MahaDevi Yoga Centre

[Image 14: MahaDevi Yoga Centre]

[Image 15: MahaDevi Yoga Centre]

Set up in 2015, 【66†MahaDevi†mahadevicentre.com】 is relatively new on the yogi scene. It’s a cosy space on Holloway Road – mats, blocks and straps are provided, but otherwise it’s a fairly basic studio, and that’s no bad thing! The modest space means that classes have a maximum of eight people, making it ideal for newbies who might need some one-to-one attention. The studio also runs a yoga therapy programme for children with disabilities, which are subsidised by profits from the adult classes. At £13 per session, it’s pretty affordable, and on top of all those post-yoga endorphins, you can feel good knowing that your money is going towards a worthy cause.

Perfect for… beginners

Average price per class: £13

Introductory offer: First class for free

Monthly membership: You can’t get one but you can buy a block of five classes for £55 or ten classes for £100

102A Holloway Rd, N7 8JE

【113†This post may contain affiliate links. Learn more】

[Image 7: 10 Of The Best Yoga Studios & Classes In London] 

* * *

Wondering where to get your zen in the capital? We’ve rounded up the best yoga classes across all corners of 【17†London】.

【114†Get Fit in London: Gyms, Studios & Classes】

## The Best Yoga Studios & Classes In London

#### 1. Sky Garden

For a truly magical yoga spot, head upwards to London’s highest green oasis, Sky Garden. Its popular yoga series in collaboration with TruBe Fitness is back for summer, offering one-hour vinyasa flow classes amongst the greenery, with panoramic views over the city. Classes take place Tuesday and Wednesday at 7am, and on weekends at 8am. Afterwards, refuel with a pastry and coffee at Sky Pod.

Address: 1 Sky Garden Walk, London EC3M 8AF

BOOK: 【115†skygarden.london†skygarden.london】

[Image 8: People doing yoga in front of huge windows]

#### 2. The Power Yoga Company

This studio in Fulham has established itself as the destination for power yoga, last year celebrating its 10th birthday. With a huge variety of yoga classes on offer at all hours of the day, seven days a week, you have no excuses not to fit practice into your schedule. Power Yoga is especially good for improving strength, balance and flexibility, helped greatly by the hand-picked selection of the best teachers in town. The nurturing and relaxed environment makes the studio perfect for newbies and advanced yogis alike.

Address: The Glass House, 11-12 Lettice Street, London SW6 4EH

BOOK: 【116†thepoweryogaco.com†thepoweryogaco.com】

[Image 9: The Power Yoga Company Class]

#### 3. Psycle

Psycle is best known for their cult-like spin sessions, but they recently started offering yoga too. Classes range from beginners to very tough – ‘Power Flow’ is a cardio/yoga hybrid class, while their OMFG class is described as ‘the toughest, sweatiest yoga class in town’. Get involved, if you dare.

Address: Multiple locations in London, see full list 【117†here†psyclelondon.com】

BOOK: 【118†psyclelondon.com†psyclelondon.com】

#### 4. Bhuti

The yoga classes on offer at Bhuti yoga and wellness centre in Richmond are seriously good. Try the Iyengar yoga for just the right balance between energising and relaxing practice to start your day or destress after work. Alongside a full schedule of yoga and pilates classes for all ages (take the really young along with you to the mother and baby classes) and abilities, there are treatment rooms for luxe spa treatments, and holistic and alternative therapies from reflexology to tarot reading. Become a member for unlimited classes and access to the workspaces and members lounges. Oh, the organic café on site is a brilliant spot for a healthy lunch, too.

Address: Bingham Riverhouse, 61-63 Petersham Road, Richmond, London TW10 6UW

BOOK: 【119†bhuti.co†bhuti.co】

[Image 10: People taking part in a yoga class in a studio]

【120†More Free Exercise in London】

#### 5. Frame Yoga Studio

Part of the hugely popular Frame group, the standalone studio at Kings Cross is well worth a visit for excellent classes in the capital. They offer ‘Anti-Desk Yoga’, a class specially designed to ease the tensions of office workers. Great as a lunchtime pick-me-up (between slouching over spreadsheets), it’s a class of gentle flow which focuses on releasing the shoulders and improving posture with long holds, to boost flexibility, de-stress and energise.

Address: Multiple locations in London, see full list 【121†here†moveyourframe.com】

BOOK: 【122†moveyourframe.com†moveyourframe.com】

[Image 11: Fitness studio with mats arranged on the floor]

#### 6. 3Tribes

This is one of the only places in London where you can experience a 50:50 mix of spinning, HIIT and yoga, so within the hour, you’ll have a hot, fast and sweaty cycle class then hop off the bike to your mat for vinyasa and deep long stretches. The gym’s name refers to the three fitness tribes on offer, rider, warrior or zen. Pick your tribe and enjoy.

Address: Multiple locations in London, see full list 【123†h
content.title: Best Yoga Classes In London 2024 | Studios & Classes

parts:
Here are some yoga studios near you in London that offer a variety of classes and memberships:

1. **MoreYoga**:
   - **Locations**: Various across London, including Surrey Quays and Tower Bridge.
   - **Membership**: Offers flexible pricing with an introductory offer of £1 for the first month. Regular classes start at £5.60 for pay-as-you-go options.
   - **Special Features**: Focus on affordability, mental health, and community. They offer a wide range of classes suitable for all levels.
   - **Website**: [MoreYoga](https://www.moreyoga.co.uk)【16†source】.

2. **Triyoga**
